reviews.text: American tourist on our last night in Naples and this was one of the best meals so far. The mussels in particular were excellent, but none of the three courses disappointed. Cute, romantic outdoor tables with the city sounds around, but no bikes driving by.

We stumbled upon this place after exiting the Augusteo station. Small, handwritten menu. Small restaurant on two sides of the street with tables outside. The food was amazing.  We had bruschetta, ravioli, seafood with pasta,marinated fish, tiramisu & cannolis. Highly recommend!

La Locanda Dei Borboni was a discovery we made while wondering around the city streets, a lovely little restaurant that transports you to somewhere else as soon as you walk through the door.

There are a few tables served by a kitchen at the back of the restaurant, this place is cute but packs a big punch serving some absolutely amazing seafood dishes. The freshness and taste is so good, and because it's such a small venue it also has that warming home cooked feel. Food made with love.

The great experience was also made from our waitress, who was originally from Sri Lanka but is also a local being completely fluent in Italian and the Neapolitan dialect. The thing that she and the restaurant give you is an experience of the pride of Naples and the South of Italy.
Very nice service and delicious food. You can sit inside or outside in a beautiful street. We loved it !

The best restaurant of the old Spanish Quarters. Setting outside and inside. Food is excellent! we came back several times and tried almost all the menu! Seafood are fresh and tasty! Mussel, calamari, shrimps...For lunch, they had a special: Fried risotto with seafood... Never hear about that and know only the traditional one...It was yummy! Pasta with seafood, with clams, mussels... everything was fresh and very tasty. No pizzas on the menu, but it's better, it's time to try others napoletan specialities!
